metadata.title: CVE-2025-0247 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 133 and Thunderbird 133. Some ofthese bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that withenough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrarycode. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 134.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2025-0247` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 134.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 134.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 134.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '134.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
